LanguageData.ReyText: Do you know what insanity is? So, now I will show you...
LanguageData.KaraText: When I tried to get out of imprisonment, the guard threatened me. And you know what? I cut his throat.
LanguageData.ZeroText: I saw flames so close that I felt my skin melt... I wonder how much heat is enough for you?
LanguageData.RendyText: I like to create stories with different outcomes. Finish your story quickly or torment a little longer, mm?
LanguageData.PhoebeText: It seems I was too kind to you and let you relax... It was not worth it.
LanguageData.CasText: I am very kind to my enemies, they would show their respect if they were alive...
LanguageData.TraitGoodMoodA: Due to the long stay in a good mood
LanguageData.TraitBadMoodA: Due to the long stay in a bad mood
LanguageData.TraitBadMoodB: gets depressed. Having passed through fire, water and copper pipes, the character can become hardened.
LanguageData.TraitCannibal: has realized after eating human flesh... that they actually sort of like it.
LanguageData.TraitHardened: learned to doesn't stop at nothing to achieve goals and gain new traits.
LanguageData.MessagePlacementOnSupport: Must place on a supporting structure!
LanguageData.PlaceWorker.TerrainCannotSupport: The terrain cannot support this object.
LanguageData.PlaceWorker.MustWaterSeaOrPile: Must be placed in shallow water or on the pilings.
LanguageData.PlaceWorker.InteractivePointMustshore: Interaction point must be placed on the shore.
LanguageData.PlaceWorker.AlreadyPile: The terrain here is already pilings.
LanguageData.ImpassableDoor: The door can be placed if there is a support structure on both sides, and if nothing block pass through the door.
LanguageData.OnMudOrWaterReportString: You can not collect here. Find the right terrain with water or mud.
LanguageData.NeedGenBioHopperDesc:
You have a BioGenerator with no hopper next to it.

To work, the BioGenerator must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with BioMatter.

Build a BioGenerator Hopper adjacent to the BioGenerator.
LanguageData.NeedFuelFeederDesc:
You have a Fuel Power Plant with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Fuel Power Plant must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Fuel.

Build a Fuel Power Plant Hopper adjacent to the Fuel Power Plant.
LanguageData.NeedGenHopperDesc:
You have a Steam Generator with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Steam Generator must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Kindling or Ethanol Fuel.

Build a Steam Generator Hopper adjacent to the Steam Generator.
LanguageData.NeedPlasmaGenFeederDesc:
You have a Plasma Reactor with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Plasma Reactor must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Bauxite Ore.

Build a Plasma Reactor Hopper adjacent to the Plasma Reactor.
LanguageData.NeedNuclearFeederDesc:
You have a Nuclear Power Plant or Military Nuclear Plant with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Nuclear Power Plant/Military Nuclear Plant must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Enriched Uranium.

Build a Nuclear Plant Hopper adjacent to the Nuclear Power Plant/Military Nuclear Plant.
LanguageData.NeedCentrifugeFeederDesc:
You have a Gas Centrifuge with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Gas Centrifuge must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Uranium Ore.

Build a Gas Centrifuge Hopper adjacent to the Gas Centrifuge.
LanguageData.NeedElectronicFeederDesc:
You have an Electronic Plant with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Electronic Plant must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Electronic Components.

Build an Electronic Plant Hopper adjacent to the Electronic Plant.
LanguageData.NeedCoalFeederDesc:
You have a Coal Power Plant with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Coal Power Plant must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Coal Ore, Charcoal or Peat.

Build a Coal Power Plant Hopper adjacent to the a Coal Power Plant.
LanguageData.AnotherGH: Too close to another Geothermal Heater.
LanguageData.NoGeothemalSource: No nearby geothermal source. Please find it.
LanguageData.AnotherPG: Too close to another Plasma Generator.
LanguageData.AnotherME: Too close to another Mine Extractor.
LanguageData.AnotherPGR: Too close to another Plasma Reactor.
LanguageData.AnotherFG: Too close to another Drilling Rig.
LanguageData.AnotherGG: Too close to another Geothermal Generator.
LanguageData.NeedOilFeederDesc:
You have an Oil Refinery with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Oil Refinery must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Crude Oil.

Build an Oil Refinery Hopper adjacent to the Oil Refinery.
LanguageData.NeedHeaterHopperDesc:
You have a Coal Burner with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Coal Burner must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Coal Ore, Charcoal or Peat.

Build a Coal Burner Hopper adjacent to the Coal Burner.
LanguageData.NearWithAnotherFissure: Too close to another fissure or Mine Extractor.
LanguageData.NeedAntimatterReactorFeederDesc:
You have an Antimatter Reactor with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Antimatter Reactor must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Antimatter.

Build an Antimatter Reactor Hopper adjacent to the the Antimatter Reactor.
LanguageData.NeedHadronColliderFeederDesc:
You have a Hadron Collider with no hopper next to it.

To work, the Hadron Collider must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with Inorganic Matter.

Build a Hadron Collider Hopper adjacent to the Hadron Collider.
LanguageData.OneTradingSpotMessage: Only one trading spot allowed per map. Removing old spot.
LanguageData.PowerSwitch_TimerClickSwitchOnTime: Timer: Click to set switch-on time.
LanguageData.PowerSwitch_TimerClickSwitchOffTime: Timer: Click to set switch-off time.
LanguageData.TempGaugeAlertDesc: One or more thermometers are reporting a temperature that exceeds the specified alert threshold.
LanguageData.TempGaugeAlertHotDesc: The temperature near one of your thermometers has exceeded the threshold of {0}.
LanguageData.TempGaugeAlertColdDesc: The temperature near one of your thermometers has dropped below the threshold of {0}.
LanguageData.AlertOnHighTemperatureDesc: Will send an alert when temperature is above {0}.
LanguageData.AlertOnLowTemperatureDesc: Will send an alert when temperature is below {0}.
LanguageData.AlertGizmoDesc: Whether the thermometer sends an alert when a specified temperature is exceeded.
LanguageData.PGLDesc: Order to grow the same kind of plant in all hydroponic basins in this room.
LanguageData.CallShipDesc: You can call a trader ship, when Subspace Burst Transponder fully charged
LanguageData.InsufficientChargeLevel: Insufficient Charge Level to Contact Ship.
LanguageData.IncHaulPriorityDesc: Increase the hauling priority of the designated items.
LanguageData.OverHaulPriorityDesc: Increase the hauling priority of the designated items
LanguageData.CanBePlacedNextToDoors: Cant be placed next to doors
LanguageData.CanBePlacedNextToWindow: Cant be placed next to window
LanguageData.WindowImpassable: Window is blocked on one or more sides.
LanguageData.WindowDoubleOutside: One side of the window must be inside.
LanguageData.WindowDoubleInside: One side of the window must be outside.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishingPier_InvalidBiome: No fish lives in this biome.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.TooCloseFishingPier: Too close from another fishing pier.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.TooCloseFishingZone: Too close from a fishing zone.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishingPier_MustTouchBank: Fishing pier must touch a bank.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishingPier_PierMustBeOnWat: Fishing pier must be placed on water.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishingPier_ZoneMustBeOnWat: Fishing zone must be placed on water.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.NeedHopperExplanation:
You have an aquaculture basin with no hopper next to it.

To breed, aquaculture basins must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with raw vegetable food or animal products.

Build a hopper adjacent to the aquaculture basin.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.IdleAquacultureBasinExplana: You have an idle aquaculture basin.\n\nEnsure a hunter can access it to start the breeding process. Select the basin if you want to modify the bred species.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.CriticalIssueExplanation:
There is a critical issue with one of your basin.

Bred fishes will die if it lasts for too long! You should check the following requirements are met:
- power supply,
- food availability,\- correct maintenance.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishesDied: Bred fishes have died in an aquaculture basin. You should check its conditions.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FisherBitten: was bitten by a tailtheeth while fishing.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.ChangeSpeciesDescription1: The aquaculture basin will start breeding
LanguageData.FishIndustry.ChangeSpeciesDescription2: once a colonist has come to change the parameters. Click to select another species.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishDescriptionMashgon: short breeding time but low meat yield
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishDescriptionBlueblade: medium breeding time and decent meat yield
LanguageData.FishIndustry.FishDescriptionTailteeth: high breeding time but yields prime meat
LanguageData.FishIndustry.EnsureHaveHunterAndEggs: Ensure you have an available hunter and some eggs (a piece of meat) to start breeding.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.BreedingRequestedButNoEggsM: Mashgons breeding requested however you have no mashgon egg in storage to start breeding.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.BreedingRequestedButNoEggsB: Blueblades breeding requested however you have no blueblade egg in storage to start breeding.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.BreedingRequestedButNoEggsT: Tailteeths breeding requested however you have no tailteeth egg in storage to start breeding.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.AllowFishingDesc: Allow your hunters to fish in this area.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.AllowUsingCornDesc: Allow your hunters to use bait to catch fishes faster and more reliably.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.MicroFungus: Some of your aquaculture basins have been infected by a strange aquatic fungus.\nIt seems to consume all the water's oxygen.\nLet's hope the fishes will survive this deprivation.
LanguageData.FishIndustry.SunkenTreasure: {0} has found a sunken treasure while fishing! What a good catch!\n
LanguageData.DeadMarineDesc:
has cought a dead body while fishing!

'This is really disgusting but look at his gear! This guy was probably a Mining Co. security member. I wonder what happend to him...'
"
LanguageData.FishIndustry.DesignatorFishingZoneDesc: Create a zone where your colonists will try to fish.
LanguageData.FuelFilterMessage: Fuel filter settings are set to default (Allow all). If you want to disable all fuel for this building, at first set Refuel to 0%
LanguageData.InsectHuntMessage: A predator insect has left its hive to hunt.
LanguageData.UniformGrowZoneDesc: A grow zone that is restricted to selecting a single soil fertility
LanguageData.AutoFlickingDesc: Automatically instructs Pawns to flick on during the day and off at night
LanguageData.SetTimesDesc: Set the times that this switch is on or off.
LanguageData.EQMess: An earthquake! Is anybody hurt? \n\nLooks like some of the buildings got severely damaged.
LanguageData.EQMessLow: An earthquake! Is anybody hurt? \n\nLooks like some of the buildings got damaged.
LanguageData.DescEQ: Warning! EARTHQUAKE! Watch out for falling debris!
LanguageData.SAMess: The Seismic activity in this region. \n\nBe careful in mountainous areas! there may be collapses.
LanguageData.LookDiscA: We found the location of the ship wreck, perhaps spacer could have survived.
LanguageData.WandererInitialSK: {PAWN_nameDef} from {0} was wandering nearby and noticed you could use some help. {PAWN_pronoun} would like to join your colony for a while.
LanguageData.MDDesc: We have found hidden mineral deposits!
LanguageData.RMDDesc: We have found hidden rare mineral deposits!
LanguageData.OFDesc: We have found a hidden oil field!
LanguageData.HeStash: was feeling generous and decided to give a treasured gun he was hiding to serve the colony. \n\nHe gave his
LanguageData.SheStash: was feeling generous and decided to give a treasured gun she was hiding to serve the colony.\n\nShe gave her
LanguageData.HeMoney: was feeling generous and decided its better to share his wealth for the colony. \n\nHe's decided to donate
LanguageData.SheMoney: was feeling generous and decided its better to share her wealth for the colony. \n\nShe's decided to donate
LanguageData.AmnesiaHeDesc: suddenly forgot what he was doing. He can't remember what to do.
LanguageData.AmnesiaSheDesc: suddenly forgot what she was doing. She can't remember what to do.
LanguageData.CalmWeatherDesc: The weather just got remarkably calm. Wind turbines will be useless, but shooting will be easier.
LanguageData.ThanksgivingDesc: One of the tribes has noticed your food stores are low. They have provided you with some food, no strings attached.\n\nThey thank you for being such good friends and they hope your friendship will be further cemented by this act.
LanguageData.DescBug: Locusts have been found in your home area! Destroy them quickly or else they will eat your apparel!
LanguageData.WarnFalling: WARNING: An unknown spacecraft is falling!
LanguageData.DescMT: The faces of the humans contained within the droppods looked terrified beyond belief. They must've experienced something horrifying
LanguageData.TheThingDesc: transformed into a huge Abomination! That mysterious transmission dropped a mutated lifeform unto us! \n\nDestroy it before it slaughters all of the colonists!
LanguageData.LetterZeonPasses: Many colonies have fallen in the hands of the mechanoid boss - Zeon. Perhaps you should consider abandoning your colony.
LanguageData.EndGame: A nearby ship from another planet cluster has received intel on the crash site based from the distress signal you dispersed during the destruction of the your ship. They have decided to come and get you and your colonists. \n\nYou can choose to end the game now and tell the rescue ship to come and get you or choose to stay, it's totally up to you.
LanguageData.HungryAnimal: One of wild animals is so starved that decided to fill his stomach with your colonist or pet!
LanguageData.LetterFeenixPasses:
A Feenix is wandering through the area. 

These legendary creatures are also known as fire incarnate. Said to be living fire, a Feenix heart is highly prized on the black market. 

While not inherintly hostile, even a solitary Feenix can lay waste to an entire colony if provoked. 

They can be tamed and even trained, but only by the bravest - and most fireproof - of men.
LanguageData.LetterIcicatPasses:
A Kirin is wandering through the area. 

Solitary and peaceful, these legendary creatures are also known as frost incarnate. Said to be living ice, a Kirin heart is highly prized on the black market. 

While docile, an enraged Kirin is a sight to behold. 

They can be tamed and even trained, but only by the bravest - and best insulated - of men.
LanguageData.RaptorArrived: Raptors arrived searching for food! Stay away! Oh, yeah. Oooh, ahhh, that's how it always starts. Then later there's running and um, screaming.
LanguageData.DevourersCropsText: Some particularly hungry devourers of crops have made their way into your garden! They'll likely hang around and keep eating your crops (and other plants) until you deal with them.
LanguageData.HungryFlockText: In one of the rooms was very dirty as well as the free access to food attracted the attention of insects which are not averse to eat.
LanguageData.DescMalariaRaid: Our area hard-hit by the malaria. /nShould be afraid of mosquitoes!
LanguageData.DescFleaRaid: Our area hard-hit by the plague. /nFleas are carriers of the plague, be careful.
LanguageData.GeostormDesc: A serious planetary scale incident following many catastrophic natural disasters. \nTomorrow, which may not be.
LanguageData.SwarmArrived: A swarm of hungry insects appeared near the colony. \nImmediately all for cover! They are here for a short while and we can wait.
LanguageData.PestsDesc: Some crop-eating bugs have found their way into your growing zones. They will eat all the crops they can find if they aren't dealt with.
LanguageData.DescAG: All of the non-human species within the area have mysteriously died off. \nThere must be some kind of super mysterious phenomena in this RimWorld.
LanguageData.DescAE: A power plant engine malfunction has caused an explosion. The power plant has been severely damaged or destroyed.
LanguageData.DescBH: A meteoroid has entered the planet's gravity well and is crashing down in a fiery explosion!
LanguageData.DescFEtwo: s in the area feral. They are merging to attack your colony so prepare a defense right away!
LanguageData.DescEM:
This Eclipse isn't caused by a moon, it's a large meteor passing by! 
Watch out for its separated section and crashing debris! 

It might have dropped precious metals!
LanguageData.DescHC: A pack of hungry carnivores is looking for food. Your colonists look like food.
LanguageData.NEDesc: WARNING!!! There was an explosion at a nuclear reactor!
LanguageData.DescRVH: An unknown calamity has struck! Most of the humans in the area have been driven insane and are attacking each other! Half of your colonists are affected. Hurry up and do something!
LanguageData.DescRV: has been found immune by the unknown calamity.
LanguageData.TribMigrDesc: A whole tribe of travellers has arrived within the area of your colony. \n\nYou can only imagine what fate has decided for them to endure this destiny.
LanguageData.MeteorStopDesc: The Meteor Shower has stopped. No further meteors detected.
LanguageData.DescBMH: A shower of meteoroids have entered the planet's gravity well and are crashing down in fiery explosions!
LanguageData.RazorOverDesc: The Razor Rain seems to be letting up.
LanguageData.DescRZ: Some debris in orbit around the planet has started to fall in the area, brace yourselves.
LanguageData.CosmicRadiationLevel: It seems that the radiation level has plummeted to a natural level.
LanguageData.DescCR: got through the radiation and is struggling to help the other colonists
LanguageData.DescHCR: Too much radiation from the solar flare has triggered cosmic radiation upon the humans within the area. \n\nEverybody feels nauseous, younger people may have fared well but the older ones are feeling ill and needs rest.
LanguageData.DescNF: Oh my God! Nuclear fallout has begun! Everything is going to die! The half-life of our uranium is 100 days.
LanguageData.PlunderersArrived: Some scouts from perhaps a nearby insectoid hive are poking around your territory. They will no doubt act as menace to both your colonists and ecosystem while they look about. Careful, it looks as though they'll engage any colonists that get too close!
LanguageData.DeepResourcesFoundA: Actually, we were going to collect potatoes here and stumbled upon
LanguageData.DeepResourcesFoundB: \n\nMaybe it's time to build a mine here?
LanguageData.MoonFallMessageMeteorSwarm: A swarm of meteors -- possibly smaller pieces of your ship -- crosses the sky, burning up in the atmosphere.
LanguageData.MoonFallMessageMeteorSwarmTribal: A swarm of meteors flame across the sky, but none crash to the ground near you.
LanguageData.SkyFallMeteorite: A lump of {0} just crashed to the ground. It was presumably once part of your ship, but the forces that ripped the ship apart, followed by the heat of uncontrolled reentry, have left nothing but a misshapen mass.
LanguageData.MoonFallMeteoriteTribal: A large meteorite has struck ground in the area. It has left behind a lump of {0}.
LanguageData.MoonFallFlashstorm: Ionization in the atmosphere from the recent cascade of ship chunks and meteorites has caused a localized flashstorm. This can cause massive fires.
LanguageData.MoonFallFlashstormTribal: The gods are angry again, but instead of hurling rocks, they now hurl lightning. A flashstorm has begun. Beware of fires.
LanguageData.SkyFallRefugeePodCrash: You've detected an escape pod crashing hard nearby.\n\nThe occupant is an old acquaintance from your ship, who's agreed to join you.
LanguageData.DescTrySuicide: tried to commit suicide, but it did not work out.
LanguageData.DescSuicide_A: One of your prisoners died in the cell and has left a final message behind. It reads: "Cameras everywhere. Watching. Always watching. The walls all around are moving, watching. Can't sleep, always watching. You see me and I don't see you! No lights here, no no. Watch you in the dark they do. Cameras, eyes of spies! You'll watch me no more!"
LanguageData.DescSuicide_B: Your prisoner smashed it's head against the wall and has died. A small piece of paper nearby has a message that was hastily scrawled. It reads: "I thought there would be easy cash in this Colony...but instead I got trapped into something horrible. I think I'm going crazy. This food...the Warden said it was "yummy, tasty, mmm" but I don't believe it. Something tastes wrong about it. My old injuries still haunt me, like a nightmare that never ends. Even the barely audible sound of the door causes me to shudder as if it were thunder".
LanguageData.DescSuicide_C: A prisoner has committed suicide shortly after asking a Colonist: "Where are my meals? I need nourishment! Muffalo meat or something! GIVE ME FOOD!"
LanguageData.DescSuicide_D: A prisoner who was found dead had kept a diary with multiple entries. It reads: "A rough cough. I feel cold and hot. I caught something, a flu maybe? No ventilation in here. Cough getting worse. My mouth is dry, it tastes like rust*blood splatter covers some words*rible. I see people sometimes, they promised me a future. To think I even liked it! I was promised food, a good bed and could one day use my skills again. I believed that, but not anymore. I need*blood splatter covers more words* worth a try.
LanguageData.DescSuicide_E: A prisoner was found deceased under the bed. A small note was crumpled up nearby. It angrily reads: "They wanted to operate on me! They were going to harvest me for organs! These people are crazies! YOU WON'T HARVEST ME ALIVE! I WON'T LET YOU!
LanguageData.DescSuicide_F: A prisoner has succumbed. A quick look at the body shows signs of infection and gangrene in hidden areas. The pain must have be extruciating.
LanguageData.DescSuicide_G: A prisoner has perished. Scrawled into the floor is a note. It reads: "Suddenly no one comes? Am I going to die here like an abandoned dog in a cage?".
LanguageData.DescSuicide_H: One of your prisoners suddenly couldn't stand up. The doctor's first thought was that the prisoner's psyche was tender, overwhelmed by the anxiety and depression from imprisonment. Then the prisoner suddenly died! Upon the autopsy examination, a long fat stick was found up the prisoner's rear and had gouged the intestines. What an unfortunate circumstance.
LanguageData.DescSuicide_I: A prisoner has died under mysterious circumstances. The body was found in the fetal position with its hands covering its eyes. The prisoner seems to have choked when it swallowed its own tongue.
LanguageData.DescSuicide_J: A prisoner has died under mysterious circumstances. A quick inspection of the body tells the tale. The prisoner seems to have tried hanging itself with a boot lace, but the lace broke. The prisoner then tried to gnaw off the door handle, as indicated by the bloody bite marks on the door. Failing that the prisoner swallowed part of the boot, where it got lodged in the throat and the prisoner suffocated.
LanguageData.DescSuicide_K: The prisoner died under mysterious circumstances. A medical summary paper was found nearby. It reads: "Patient has distemper, intestinal ticks and show signs of being in a delirious state. Patient has tried to eat it's own feet and hands. I recommend isolating the patient and attempting experimental procedures. It might have lupus."
LanguageData.DescSuicide_L: A prisoner has been found dead under the bed, and a scrap of paper was found nearby. It looks like a mission report and it reads: "Here is your job. Land at the listed co-ordinates and grab some weapons, ammunition, rations and armor. Then follow us and assault the illegal colony. They shouldn't be here and we're going to enforce that. You may be a rookie but this will be easy. They won't know what hit 'em!".
LanguageData.DescSuicide_M: A prisoner has died. A message was found in a notebook. It reads: "We were waiting for orders when suddenly some air defense shot down our ship! I survived by jumping in the escape pod. When the pod opened I was immediately under fire. I was caught and imprisoned. I don't know what happened to the others. I don't think I'll be leaving this place alive. If you're still monitoring me, let them know what happened and tell them to stay away from this place".
LanguageData.DescSuicide_N: A prisoner has suddenly died. A strange message was found scrawed on a medical paper. It reads "They wanted to do a test procedure on me with experimental bionics and regenerative tissue. They wanted to cut off my leg. So, I passed. I'll show them that I don't need medical help! My flesh and blood is my own, a little infection won't stop me! I AM INVINCIBLE!"
LanguageData.DamagedTent: Damaged tent deployed. Some walls will be missing.
LanguageData.TentPlacementBlocked: Tent placement blocked by a item, pawn or a building. Please deploy on a suitable space.
LanguageData.TentPlacementBlockedTree: Tent placement blocked by a tree. Please deploy on a suitable space.
LanguageData.TentPlacementBlockedSimple: Tent placement blocked. Please deploy on a suitable space.
LanguageData.CantPlaceTent: Cannot place a fully damaged tent.
LanguageData.RL_CannotChangeMod: Cannot change mode now, rod still discharging.
LanguageData.RL_PowerSavingMode: Power saving mode(Click to change modes): Does not consume power when idle, outputs a lot of power when struck, but only has a
LanguageData.RL_ChanceToAttract: chance to attract a lightning bolt and cools down
LanguageData.RL_NormalMode: Normal mode(Click to change modes): Consumes a bit of power when idle, outputs enough power to sustain itself in a storm and has a 100% chance to attract a lightning bolt. Can attract lightning at a
LanguageData.RL_FastCooldown: Fast cooldown mode(Click to change modes): Cools down 4x faster than normal but consumes triple the amount of power. Has a 100% chance to attract a lightning bolt. Can attract lightning at a
LanguageData.supervize_sientist_IC: The ion cannon controller is not supervized by a skilled scientist (level 10 research).
LanguageData.supervize_controller_IC: The ion cannon controller is not supervized.
LanguageData.controller_not_ready_IC: The ion cannon controller is not ready.
LanguageData.NoMoreThanOne: Can't to build more then one for the map!
LanguageData.FillFissureReq: Are you sure you wish to fill in this fissure?
LanguageData.BeginDrillDesc: Click here to begin the drilling process.
LanguageData.PauseDrillDesc: Click here to pause the drilling process.
LanguageData.ResumeDrillDesc: Click here to resume the drilling process.
LanguageData.ExhaustedMine: One of your Mine Extractors is exhausted. Disassemble it and build a new one.
LanguageData.ExhaustedFissure: One of your Oil Fissures is exhausted. Disassemble the Oil Extrator and drill a new Oil Fissure.
LanguageData.ChopWoodDesc: Marks fully grown trees to be chopped down for Wood Logs.
LanguageData.DesignatorPlantsHarvestEdiblesDesc: Marks human edible plants to be harvested for their food or other products.
LanguageData.MessageMustDesignateHarvestableFruits: Must designate harvestable sufficiently-grown human edible plants.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectSandDesc: Use this to collect Sand. This is a low priority "Mining" task.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectSandReportString: You can not collect here. You need sand terrain to collect Sand.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectPeatDesc: Use this to collect peat. This is a low priority "Mining" task.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectPeatReportString: You can not collect here. You need swamp terrain to collect Peat.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectCrushedstoneDesc: Use this to collect Rubble. This is a low priority "Mining" task.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectCrushedstoneReportStrin: You can not collect here. You need gravel terrain to collect Rubble.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectSoftClayDesc: Designate areas of mud or shallow water to collect Soft Clay. This is a low priority "Mining" task.
LanguageData.DesignatorCollectSoftClayReportString: You can not collect here. You need water or mud terrain to collect Soft Clay.
LanguageData.BlastDoorJammed: The Blast Door has jammed from taking damage.\nRepair it now in order to close it immediately.
LanguageData.JammedRepaired: The Jammed Blast Door has been repaired and is now closed.
LanguageData.JammedBudgedClosed: The Jammed Blast Door budged and is now closed.
LanguageData.JammedBudgedWontClose: The Jammed Blast Door budged but it won't close.
LanguageData.CommandAddDangerZoneDesc: Creates an area outside radiation danger radius.
LanguageData.WildAnimalHuntingDesc: A wild animal is currently hunting a member of your colony.
LanguageData.FeastPartyDesc: Click to start a feast party.
LanguageData.FeastNoDrafted: Not enough colonists near the table to start feast! Please draft more colonists.
LanguageData.MineBrushDesc: Finally a brush for mining. Use q and e to change size.
LanguageData.StripMinerDesc: Drag an area to strip mine. Use 8,4,5,6 on your !NUMBLOCK! to change spacing between strips.
LanguageData.VeinMinerDesc: Click on a visible ore and you will mine the whole vein.
LanguageData.VeinMinerReport: Must designate mineable and accessable ore!
LanguageData.CaveworldFlora.MustOnRoughRock: Fungiponics basin must be built on rough rock.
LanguageData.CaveworldFlora.TooClose: An other fungiponics basin is too close.
LanguageData.Tend_notEnoughSkill: Requires a colonist with a medical skill of 8 or higher to tend prisoner.
LanguageData.CaveworldFlora.BlackLotus: One of your colonists has been intoxicated by the effluvium of a black lotus. Beware, those emanations are extremely toxic.
LanguageData.studyreport:
### Study report ###

Study subject: strange mechanoid artifact

- Artifact location:
LanguageData.observation:
- Observations:
 1. the artifact has deployed underground foundations.
 2. some pylons have been erected near the main structure.
 3. the artifact seems to generate powerful artificial thunderstorms.

- Deductions:
 1. this device appears to be a mechanoid terraformer.
 2. its purpose is to re-shape the surface of this planet to prepare a large-scale invasion.

- Recommandations:
 1. proceed with *extreme* caution when attempting anything on the artifact!
 2. deactivating the onboard beacon should be a priority to avoid future invasion.
 3. consider re-routing the power generated during artificial thunderstorms.
 4. further research may allow us to take advantage of those artificial thunderstorms.
LanguageData.noskill: is not skilled enough to extract the terraformer weather controller (research level
LanguageData.noskill_net: is not skilled enough to reroute the terraformer power network (research level
LanguageData.noskilk_ext: is not skilled enough to extract the terraformer weather controller (research level
LanguageData.noskill_rer: is not skilled enough to reroute the terraformer power network (research level
LanguageData.noskill_study: is not skilled enough to study the strange artifact (research level
LanguageData.attack: Attacking the artifact seems to be a bad idea. You have detected some sort of emergency call sent from it.\nWhatever it is, this does not sound good at all...
LanguageData.Before_extraction: Before its extraction, the mechanoid terraformer AI core controller somehow detected your attempts at shutting it down.\nIt had enough time to emit an emergency call. Be prepared to welcome the incoming terrafomer defending force.
LanguageData.success_extract: You have successfully extracted the weather controller from the mechanoid terraformer.\n\nYou can now build your own one to unleash the sky's wrath on your ennemies.
LanguageData.success_reroute: You have successfully rerouted the power network of the mechanoid terraformer.\n\nRemember that you need some batteries to stock the brief surges of energy generated by the thunderstorms.
LanguageData.invaders: Beware! The mechanoid invasion has begun. This world will soon become a new mechanoid hive!
LanguageData.strange_thing: You have detected a strange thing falling from the sky. It is quite bigger than a drop pod and does not emit the standard trading federation emergency call.\nYou should send someone to scout it but be careful, this stinks mechanoid technology...
LanguageData.some_knowledge: has some knowledge about alien technology but
LanguageData.terr_beacon: still failed at properly disabling the terraformer beacon.\n\nBe prepared to welcome the incoming terrafomer defending force.
LanguageData.success_disabling: successfully disabled the terraformer beacon!\n\nYou have nothing to fear from it anymore.
LanguageData.alien_about: is not the best about alien technology,
LanguageData.real_crack: is a real crack in alien technology. Disabling the terraformer beacon was just another game for
LanguageData.no_fear: \n\nYou have nothing to fear from it anymore.
LanguageData.try_to_disable: has tried to disable the terraformer beacon but technology is not
LanguageData.button_press: just pressed on every button alerting by the way every nearby mechanoid shuttles.\n\nBe prepared to welcome some nasty and numerous visitors from nearby mechanoid hives!
LanguageData.hear: hears the loud noise of incoming drop pods.\n\nYou should better take
LanguageData.strange_building: is just arriving near the strange building when
LanguageData.secure_artifact:
You have secured the strange building.

You are now sure of one thing: this is a mechanoid device.
As usual when dealing with mechanoid technology, be really careful. You should better be prepared for anything...
LanguageData.repstudy:
report is quite alarming!

LanguageData.AJLetter: The animal you rescued is joining the colony
LanguageData.ADJLetter: The animal you rescued isn't joining the colony
LanguageData.Traitor:
A colonist named {PAWN_nameDef}, which you have accepted into your ranks, turns out to be an enemy agent from {PAWN_factionName}.
You can capture him for recruitment or slavery purposes.
LanguageData.CAWI:
A group of {PAWN_kind}, abandoned or lost, wanders in.
They seem to have belonged to some caravan, as they still carry packs with valuable items. You can collect these items if you tame them or kill them. Otherwise, they will leave the area in a couple of days.
LanguageData.CS2: has sprouted nearby. If you wait for it to grow, you will be able to harvest plenty of food! If left unharvested, it will slowly rot and disappear.
LanguageData.BAWI:
A group of {0}, abandoned or lost, wanders in.
They seem accustomed to human contact and are joining the colony.
LanguageData.WMWI: A small, pre-neolithic tribe of wild men wanders in. You can attempt to tame them.
LanguageData.HP: A group of hunters from {0} are passing through the area. They will hunt here for a few hours and then move on.
LanguageData.ManhunterPackArrived:
A pack of man-hunting {0} have entered the area. They will roam the region, hunting for humanoid flesh.

They won't attack doors unless they see someone go through the door. Hide inside and you'll be safe. They also won't attack turrets that are powered down, so turn your turrets off to save them.

The {0} will leave the area in one or two days. You can hide and wait them out, or fight them.
LanguageData.AncientStargate_Report1: has finished the study of the strange artifact.
LanguageData.AncientStargate_Report2:
report is really fanstastic!


### Study references ###

Date:
LanguageData.AncientStargate_StudyReport:
### Study report ###

Study subject: Interdimensional ancient artifact.

- Artifact location:
LanguageData.AncientStargate_Observation:
- Observations:
 1. It is a few rings measuring 3.14 meters in diameter.
 2. Made from exotic material, previously unknown, built by some ancient civilization.
 3. When the inner ring is rotated, a stable one-way wormhole is created between the calling ring and the called ring, and it looks like you can instantly move any objects into the wormhole ...

- Выводы: 
 1. We will call this building - Stargate.
 2. It seems that something is missing in its device and the artifact is able to work only in one direction, as a "receiver". 
- Recommendations:
 1. Proceed with *extreme* caution when attempting anything on the artifact! 
 2. Perhaps we will be able to study its device in more detail and use it in the future to move in interdimensional space. 
 3. On the other hand, it may be useful to us for the materials of which it consists, having at first glance, incredible strength.
